com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values

Class Value

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiscreteValue, IntValue, ObjectValue, RealJointValue, RealValue

    public abstract class Value
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Holder for a values for a given Domain.

    Subclasses are implemented to take advantage of knowledge of domain values.

    Since:
    0.05
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Value

        public Value()

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Value create(@Nullable
           Domain domain)
        Creates a Value instance appropriate to the given domain with a default value depending on the domain: zero for numeric domains, the first element for discrete domains, and null for ObjectDomain.

        If domain is null, an ObjectValue will be returned.

      • create

        public static RealValue create(RealDomain domain)
        Creates a RealValue instance for given domain.

      • create

        public static DiscreteValue create(DiscreteDomain domain)
        Creates a DiscreteValue instance for given domain.

      • create

        public static FiniteFieldValue create(FiniteFieldDomain domain)
        Creates a FiniteFieldValue instance for given domain.
        Since:
        0.07

      • create

        public static Value create(Domain domain,
           @Nullable
           java.lang.Object value)
        Creates a Value instance for given domain with specified initial value.

        Simply calls setObject(Object) on instance returned by create(Domain).

      • create

        public static DiscreteValue create(DiscreteDomain domain,
                   java.lang.Object value)
        Creates a DiscreteValue instance for given domain with specified initial value.

        Simply calls setObject(Object) on instance returned by create(DiscreteDomain).

      • create

        public static RealValue create(RealDomain domain,
               double value)
        Creates a RealValue instance for given domain with specified initial value.

      • create

        public static RealJointValue create(RealJointDomain domain,
                    double[] value)
        Creates a RealJointValue instance for given domain with specified initial value.

      • getDomain

        public abstract Domain getDomain()
        Domain for valid contents of value object.

      • getObject

        @Nullable
public abstract java.lang.Object getObject()
        Returns current value as a Object.

        This may create a new object if underlying representation is a primitive type such as int or double; in such cases it is preferable to use getInt(), getDouble(), etc.

      • setObject

        public abstract void setObject(@Nullable
             java.lang.Object value)
        Sets current value from an Object.

        public void setFiniteField(FiniteFieldNumber value)

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        If value is known to be a member of a DiscreteDomain, returns its index within its domain otherwise -1.

      • getInt

        public int getInt()
        Returns current value as a int.

      • setFrom

        public void setFrom(Value value)
        Sets contents from another value.

        Default implementation uses getObject()/setObject(Object). Subclasses implement this more efficiently to avoid Object conversion.

      • setIndex

        public void setIndex(int index)
        If value is known to be a member of a DiscreteDomain, sets value to element with given index within the domain.

      • setInt

        public void setInt(int value)
        Sets contents from a int.

      • setBoolean

        public void setBoolean(boolean value)
        Sets contents from a boolean Subclasses should override this to set a boolean in the appropriate form
        Since:
        0.07

      • valueEquals

        public boolean valueEquals(Value other)
        True if setFrom(Value) on other would not change the state of this value.

        Default implementation compares getObject() values.

      • copyFromObjects

        public static <T extends Value> T[] copyFromObjects(java.lang.Object[] objs,
                                    T[] output)
        Fills in and returns Value array from array of objects.
        Parameters:
        objs - must have values that are compatible with members of output array.
        output - must be the same length as object array and contain concrete Value instances compatible with corresponding objects.
        Returns:
        output argument
        See Also:
        createFromObjects(Object[], Class, Domain...)

      • createFromObjects

        public static <T extends Value> T[] createFromObjects(java.lang.Object[] objs,
                                      java.lang.Class<T> valueClass,
                                      Domain... domains)
        Creates Value array from array of objects using declared subclass type and provided domains.
        Parameters:
        objs -
        valueClass - specifies the component type of the the returned array.
        domains - specifies the domains of the objects. This must have between 1 and objs.length elements. If less than the maximum, the last domain will be applied to all remaining objects.
        Returns:
        array of Value instances containing the corresponding values from the object array.
        See Also:
        createFromObjects(Object[], Domain...), copyFromObjects(Object[], Value[])

      • createFromObjects

        public static Value[] createFromObjects(java.lang.Object[] objs,
                        Domain... domains)
        Same as createFromObjects(Object[], Class, Domain...)

      • createFromDomains

        public static Value[] createFromDomains(Domain... domains)
        Creates Value array with empty or default content from array of Domains.
        Parameters:
        domains - specifies the domains of the objects. This must have between 1 and objs.length elements. If less than the maximum, the last domain will be applied to all remaining objects.
        Returns:
        array of Value instances each with the corresponding domain.
        Since:
        0.07

      • createFromDomains

        public static Value[] createFromDomains(DomainList<?> domains)
        Creates Value array with empty or default content from a DomainList.
        Parameters:
        domains - specifies the domains of the objects. This must have between 1 and objs.length elements. If less than the maximum, the last domain will be applied to all remaining objects.
        Returns:
        array of Value instances each with the corresponding domain.
        Since:
        0.07

      • toObjects

        public static <T extends Value> java.lang.Object[] toObjects(T[] values,
                                             java.lang.Object[] output)
        Copies current contents of values into output array.

      • toObjects

        public static <T extends Value> java.lang.Object[] toObjects(T[] values)
        Converts an array of Value to an array of Object containing the current contents of the values.
